task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block, approach and align the circular end-effector to a suitable contact face, then push the block toward the marked goal, repeating the push if needed, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm with a cylindrical end-effector interacts on a white tabletop. The scene contains a red T-shaped block and a small circular mark on the workspace indicating the goal region. The robot must perceive the block and the goal, approach above the block, refine alignment, then apply one or more planar pushes to move the T toward the goal. Motions run at ~10 Hz perception/control; careful alignment helps maintain contact during the push.
preconditions: Workspace is clear aside from the T-block and goal mark
End-effector is free and above the table
Camera provides view of block and goal
stepwise_plan: Set identifiers for object and goal
Detect block; if not visible, actively detect
Detect goal; if not visible, actively detect
Move above the block at a safe height
Approach and align to the block with tight tolerance
Set yaw to align push direction
Push the block a short distance twice
success_criteria: Block translated toward/into the goal region
No loss of contact during push segments
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss → fall back to DetectObject
Misalignment → re-ticking the sequence re-runs ApproachAndAlign
task_long_description.termination: Sequence completes after retreat and wait, or a child action times out/fails without recovery.

frame_3.now_evidence: End-effector has made first stable contact/alignment with the T’s stem.
frame_3.predicts_next: A push actuation is likely to follow along the table plane.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Check if a named target is currently visible.
Actively detect the target if not already visible.
Move above target at specified vertical offset.
Refine in-plane alignment to the block within a tolerance.
Rotate tool yaw to align push direction.
Planar push of the target by a short distance along a direction.
Back off from the object after pushing.

failure_modes: Block not detected due to occlusion
Timeout during approach due to path obstruction
recovery_strategy: Fallback to DetectObject when visibility check fails
Re-tick sequence to re-run ApproachAndAlign if contact lost
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a blue goal mark; instruction mentions gray block and green target—frames preferred.
Push direction set to 90° in camera frame as a proxy for goalward motion; real policy may compute direction from detections.
10 Hz note does not map to library ports; timeouts binned independently.

expected_success_criteria: After pushes, the T-block is closer to or inside the goal mark
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose
